meanings.definition: The quality of being impossible to refute or disprove.
meanings.sent1: The irrefutability of the evidence left no room for doubt.
meanings.sent2: Scientists rely on the irrefutability of their research findings.
meanings.sent3: The detective's confidence in the suspect's guilt was based on the irrefutability of the fingerprints.
meanings.sent4: The lawyer's argument was built on the irrefutability of the witness testimony.
meanings.sent5: The irrefutability of the mathematical proof amazed the students.

meanings.sent1: The irrefutability of the claim was evident to all who heard it.
meanings.sent2: She presented her case with such irrefutability that no one dared to challenge her.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick had an air of irrefutability that baffled the audience.
meanings.sent4: The irrefutability of the historical document silenced all skeptics.
meanings.sent5: His argument had an irrefutability that made it impossible to ignore.
